title: Bug 49890 - Nio Selector issue on Linux platform
description:
Bug 49890 - Nio Selector issue on Linux platform

Description: Sometimes, the server's CPU reaches 100% and stays at 100% until the server is restarted. This issue has been reproduced with Java versions 1.6.007, 1.6.018, and 1.6.021. It seems to be a duplicate of issue Bug 46373. Jetty has made some fixes related to this problem: http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/JETTY937?focusedCommentId=168060&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:commenttabpanel

Steps to Reproduce: To reproduce the JVM bug, perform several requests to the web application (e.g. press F5 in the browser and hold the button).
OB: The server's CPU usage reaches 100% and remains at 100% until the server is restarted.
EB: Perform multiple requests to the web application (e.g. press F5 in the browser and hold the button) to reproduce the JVM bug.
